report.title: Charles II, 1664 & 1665
report.subtitle: Chapter XII. An A&bholigct; for making the River Avon navigable from Christ Church to the City of New Sarum.

section.para: [This A&bholigct; has been called Chap. XII. in various printed Editions of the Statutes, but it is not upon the Roll; the Title is entered on the Roll amongst the Titles of Private A&bholigct;s in the above manner, and is here inserted in order to keep up the usual arrangement of Chapters.]

Item quedam petic[i]ones privatas personas concernentes (in se formam A&bholigct;us continentes) exhibite fuerunt &bhopcrl;di&bholigct;o Domino Regi in Parliamento &bhopcrl;di&bholigct;o quar[um] Tituli subscribuntur.
1. An A&bholigct; to enable Sir Edward Hungerford Knight of the Bath to sell certaine Lands in the County of Devon.
2. An A&bholigct; for the enabling of Trustees to sell part of the Estate of Samuel Sandys the elder Esquire and of his son Samuel Sandys for payment of debts.
3. An A&bholigct; for confirming a Deed of Setlement between The Earl of Thanet and his younger Brothers.

4. An A&bholigct; to enable the Bishop of Winchester to convey One hundred acres of Land lying in the great disparked Parke of Bishops Waltham in the Parish of Bishops Waltham in the County of Southampton upon the Re&bholigct;or of the said Parish Church of Bishops Waltham and his Successors in lieu of all Tithes and Payments for Tythes due to the said Re&bholigct;or and his Successors for Waltham Parks.
5. An A&bholigct; to enable the Lord Henry Powlet George Withers and John Mompesson to sell the Mannor of Abbots-Anne in the County of Southampton
6. An A&bholigct; to enable Henry Lord Lougborough to make the River and Sewer navigable from or neere Bristowe Causey in the County of Surrey into the River of Thames.
7. An A&bholigct; to enable Trustees for the Lord Strangford to sell Lands for payment of debts.
8. An A&bholigct; for restoring of Sir Charles Stanley in blood
9. An A&bholigct; for the setling of several Mannors Lands and Tenements of Sir Jacob Astley lying in the Counties of Norfolk and Warwick.
10. An A&bholigct; for setling the Estate of Sir Robert Carr Baronet.
11. An A&bholigct; for making the River Avon navigable from Christ Church to the City of New Sarum.
12. An A&bholigct;t for making the River of Medway navigable in the Counties of Kent and Sussex
13. An A&bholigct; for making divers Rivers navigable or otherwise passable for Boats Barges and other Vessels.
14. An A&bholigct; for setling of differences between the Towns of Great and Little Yarmouth touching the lading and unlading of Herrings and other Merchandises and Comodities.
15. An A&bholigct; for the naturalizing Dederic alias Richard Comes and others.
16. An A&bholigct; for confirming of an A&bholigct; intituled An A&bholigct; to enable Joseph Micklethwaite an Infant and his Trustees to sell Land for payment of his Fathers debts.
17. An A&bholigct; for the inabling of Thomas Luckes of Treliddan in the County of Mountgomery Esq&bhoqesq; to sell Lands for the payment of his debts and raising of younger Childrens portions.
18. An A&bholigct; to inable Francis Lee Esq&bhoqesq; to sell Lands, for payment of debts and to make provision for his Children.
19. An A&bholigct; for continuance of a former A&bholigct; for repairing the Highwayes within the County of Hertford
20. An A&bholigct; for draining of the Fenn called Deeping-Fenn and other Fenns therein mentioned
